queries.description: If an an object defined with a volatile-qualified type is referred to with an lvalue of a non-volatile-qualified type, the behavior is undefined.
queries.name: Do not access a volatile object through a nonvolatile reference

implementation_scope.description: In limited cases, this query can raise false-positives for assignment of volatile objects and subsequent accesses of those objects via non-volatile pointers.

EXP32-C.title: Do not access a volatile object through a nonvolatile reference

queries.description: Converting a pointer to a different type results in undefined behavior if the pointer is not correctly aligned for the new type.
queries.name: Do not cast pointers into more strictly aligned pointer types

EXP36-C.title: Do not cast pointers into more strictly aligned pointer types

queries.description: Modifying underlying pointer data through a pointer of an incompatible type can lead to unpredictable results.
queries.name: Do not access a variable through a pointer of an incompatible type

EXP39-C.title: Do not access a variable through a pointer of an incompatible type

queries.description: Passing an aliased pointer to a restrict-qualified parameter is undefined behavior.
queries.name: Do not pass aliased pointers to restrict-qualified parameters

queries.description: Restrict qualified pointers referencing overlapping objects is undefined behavior.
queries.name: Do not assign the value of a restrict-qualified pointer to another restrict-qualified pointer

EXP43-C.title: Avoid undefined behavior when using restrict-qualified pointers
